Title: Satellites Help Improve Crop Yields in India
Description: Satellites provide crucial information for researchers to monitor and help improve agricultural productivity in India.

Title: Fires and Smoke in India and Pakistan
Description: Image captured on Nov 1, 2022 by the VIIRS instrument aboard the joint NASA/NOAA Suomi NPP satellite.

Title: Brahmaputra River, India
Description: Image captured on 9 January 2017 by the MODIS instrument, aboard the Terra satellite.

Title: Fires in Northwest India
Description: Image captured on 26 October 2016 by the Visible Infrared Imaging Radiometer Suite (VIIRS) instrument, aboard the joint NASA/NOAA Suomi National Polar-orbiting Partnership (Suomi NPP) satellite.

Title: Tropical Cyclone Vardah approaching India
Description: Image captured on 11 December 2016 by the VIIRS instrument, aboard the joint NASA/NOAA Suomi NPP satellite.

Title: Fires and Smoke in Northern India
Description: Image captured on 13 November 2017, by the VIIRS instrument, aboard the joint NASA/NOAA Suomi NPP satellite.

Title: High Aerosol Index Over Northern India
Description: Image captured on 9 November 2020, by the OMPS instrument, aboard the joint NASA/NOAA Suomi NPP satellite.

Title: High Aerosol Optical Depth over Northern India
Description: Image captured on 24 December 2018, by the MODIS instrument, aboard the Terra satellite.

Title: Smoke and fires in northwest India—November 2015
Description: Image captured on 9 November 2015 by the MODIS instrument, aboard the Aqua satellite.

Title: Smoke and Fires in Northwest India—November 2016
Description: Image captured on 28 November 2016 by the VIIRS instrument, aboard the joint NASA/NOAA Suomi NPP satellite.

Title: Paving a New Lifestyle
Description: As rapid urbanization transforms India's landscape, doctors face a new set of challenges in protecting public health.

Title: High Aerosol Index over Punjab, India
Description: Image captured Nov. 1, 2021, by the VIIRS instrument aboard the joint NASA/NOAA Suomi NPP satellite.

Title: From Indonesia to India
Description: Researchers follow the wanderings of fresh water in the tropics.

Title: The Price of Tea
Description: Satellites help make a satisfying brew.

Title: User Profile: Dr. Pinki Mondal
Description: Who uses NASA Earth science data? Dr. Pinki Mondal, to study the effects of climate change on agricultural systems and communities.

Title: User Profile: Dr. Karen Seto
Description: Who uses NASA Earth science data? Dr. Karen Seto, to study the environmental effects of urbanization.

Title: Can Citizen Science and Low-Cost Sensors Help Improve Earth System Data?
Worldview Image of the Week Archive
Description: Each week, Earthdata features a new image showcasing the data and visualizations available within Worldview. Worldview uses NASA's Global Imagery Browse Services (GIBS) to rapidly retrieve its imagery for an interactive browsing experience.

Title: User Profile: Dr. Steven Massie
Description: Aerosols have a huge impact on climate and human health. Dr. Steven Massie uses remotely-sensed data to better understand these impacts and improve how aerosols are detected by Earth observing satellites.

Title: The Sundarbans
Description: Image captured on 24 February 2018, by the MODIS instrument, aboard the Aqua satellite.

Title: Squeezing Water from Rock
Description: Studying modern earthquakes that produce liquefaction can help better interpret the geologic record of liquefaction during past events.

Title: User Profile: Dr. Brian Mapes
Description: Who uses NASA Earth science data? Dr. Brian Mapes, to study large-scale weather and climate processes.

Title: User Profile: Dr. Faisal Hossain
Description: For the people of Asia and Southeast Asia, water is integral to their livelihood. Dr. Hossain uses NASA Earth observing data to improve water management and accelerate economic development in these regions.

Title: And the Winners Are . . .
Description: See who took home top honors in the world’s largest global hackathon.

Title: When the Earth Moved Kashmir
Description: Science and relief efforts come together in the aftermath of the 2005 Kashmir earthquake.

Title: Worldview Snapshots Links to Rapid Response Subsets
Description: To assist in the transition from NASA's Rapid Response Subsets, this list of links is provided for users to go to the corresponding area in Worldview Snapshots.

Title: Karakoram Mountain Range
Description: Image captured on 29 April 2018, by the MODIS instrument, aboard the Terra satellite.

Title: Tropical Cyclone Tauktae
Description: Image captured on 17 May 2021, by the VIIRS instrument, aboard the joint NASA/NOAA Suomi NPP satellite.

Title: Tropical Cyclone Amphan in the Bay of Bengal
Description: Image captured on 18 May 2020 at 12:10 UTC, by the AHI instrument, aboard the Himawari-8 satellite.

Title: A Kink in the Jet Stream
Description: Extreme weather events thousands of miles apart may be linked.

Title: NASA Expands Contract with Planet Labs Inc. for Satellite Imagery
Description: The contract expansion significantly broadens the availability of Planet imagery distributed by NASA’s Commercial Smallsat Data Acquisition (CSDA) program.

Title: Himalaya's Heat Pump
Description: Polluted air over Asia is changing patterns in remote mountain ranges.

Title: Winter Blooms in the Arabian Sea
Description: A tiny organism and its tenants make an unexpected appearance.

Title: Measuring the World's Croplands
Description: The Global Food Security-support Analysis Data (GFSAD) collection provides detailed maps of agricultural croplands around the world at 30-meter spatial resolution.

Title: Nighttime Images Show Changes in Human Activity
Description: Nighttime satellite images provide a unique global picture of how human activities are changing on a daily basis. Images from January 19 and February 4, 2020

Title: Eight Citizen Science Projects Receive NASA Funding
Description: NASA’s Citizen Science for Earth Systems Program (CSESP) announces eight citizen science projects funded through the 2020 NASA Research Opportunities in Space and Earth Sciences (ROSES) solicitation.

Title: NASA Announces Winners of 2022 Global Space Apps Challenge
Description: Ten teams from around the globe took home top honors in the world’s largest annual hackathon addressing real-world problems on Earth and in space.

Title: An Earth System Data Record of Earth's Surface Mass Variations from GRACE and Geodetic Satellites
MOPITT Data Now Available in LANCE
Description: Global carbon monoxide data from the MOPITT instrument aboard NASA’s Terra satellite are the newest near real-time products available through the Land, Atmosphere Near real-time Capability for EOS (LANCE).

Title: Effects of Emissions on Climate Change
Description: Separating human-caused climate change from natural climatic variability.

Title: Matter in Motion: Earth's Changing Gravity
Description: A new satellite mission sheds light on Earth's gravity field and provides clues about changing sea levels.

Title: Crazy Bad Air
Description: Open sharing of pollution data helps Chinese netizens brave the politics of murky air.

Title: SpaceML: Rise of the Machine (Learning)
Description: A global team is using artificial intelligence and machine learning to enable users to search for specific features in satellite imagery available through NASA’s Global Imagery Browse Services (GIBS).

Title: Fusing Five Satellite Instruments' Data Into One Dataset: Introducing Terra Fusion
Description: Terra Fusion, a new data product and toolkit, allows researchers to combine data from all five Terra instruments into one cohesive dataset.

Title: Lake Observations from Citizen Scientists and Satellites
Nighttime Lights
Description: Backgrounder on VIIRS day/night band and its applications.

Title: Terra: Five Instruments—One Monumental Data Record
Description: After more than 20 years in space, the five instruments aboard NASA’s Terra satellite continue their singular achievement of compiling a climate data record of Earth.

Title: The Flood Hunters
Description: Researchers develop a long-term archive of satellite data that will help hydrologists monitor floods, allow aid agencies to pinpoint flood-prone regions, and provide information for modeling some of the Earth's complex hydrologic cycles.

Title: NASA FIRMS Helps Fight Wildland Fires in Near Real-Time
Description: NASA’s worldwide Fire Information for Resource Management System (FIRMS) provides vital near real-time tools for managing wildland fires.

Title: User Profile: Dr. Thomas A. Herring
Description: The Global Navigation Satellite System (GNSS) enables the precise location of points on Earth’s surface. For geodesists like Dr. Herring, it also is a key geodetic technique for his studies of surface deformation processes.

Title: Rooting Out Rainfall
Description: Polar water fuels off-kilter rainfall in the tropics.

Title: When the Big Picture is Not Enough
Description: A researcher pushes the limits of radar data to monitor small rice fields in the Philippines.

Title: User Profile: Dr. Piyush Agram
Description: Who uses NASA Earth science data? Dr. Piyush Agram, for developing Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) data products.

Title: Sensing Invasive Species From Space
Description: Invasive species cost the U.S. economy approximately $120 billion a year and disrupt the dynamics of ecosystems. Researchers are increasingly using remote sensing to map where invasive species are and where they could spread in order to minimize their damage.

Title: Wildfires Can't Hide from Earth Observing Satellites
Description: Sensors aboard Earth observing satellites and NASA’s Fire Information for Resource Management System (FIRMS) provide information about wildfires 24/7 to anyone, anywhere in the world.

Title: User Profile: Dr. Kristy Tiampo
Description: More than half of Earth’s population lives in urban environments. NASA Earth science data help Dr. Kristy Tiampo explore the hazards that can impact these areas.

Title: Diseases Data Pathfinder
Description: Vector-borne diseases are responsible for over 17% of all the infectious diseases globally. Many of these diseases are preventable through protective measures, provided local authorities are aware of the potential outbreaks of the responsible vectors. This data pathfinder links to NASA datasets and tools that can aid with decisions regarding disease outbreaks that are often associated with environmental factors (seasonality, habitat suitability for vector, etc.) that NASA measurements can provide data to assess.

Title: New Tools for Diplomacy
Description: Remote sensing plays a central role in the management of foreign policy.

Title: User Profile: Dr. Navin Ramankutty
Description: Approximately one-third of Earth’s ice-free land surface is devoted to agriculture and livestock. Dr. Ramankutty uses Earth observing data to help find pathways to more sustainable agricultural practices.

Title: Extreme Heat Data Pathfinder
Description: Extreme heat events lasting a few days to weeks at a time are occurring more frequently in major cities across the world and can have detrimental impacts on public health. NASA data can help forecast and monitor these events.

Title: Air Quality
Description: NASA LANCE near real-time data can be used by air quality forecasters to improve some local and national air quality forecasts.

Title: User Profile: Lori Schultz
Description: NASA near real-time data help Lori Schultz respond to agencies that reach out to NASA in the wake of natural disasters.

Title: Data More Powerful than Hurricanes
Description: New ways of looking at data help storm forecasters and emergency managers solve challenges and prevent hurricane losses.

Title: Health and Air Quality Data Pathfinder
Description: Air pollution is one of the largest global environmental and health threats. Instruments aboard NASA satellite and airborne platforms continually acquire data about these pollutants.

Title: Health and Air Quality
Description: Outdoor air pollution contributes to millions of deaths every year, making it one of the biggest global health risks.

Title: Diseases Data Pathfinder - Find Data
Description: Vector-borne diseases are responsible for over 17% of all the infectious diseases globally. Many of these diseases are preventable through protective measures, provided local authorities are aware of the potential outbreaks of the responsible vectors. This data pathfinder links to NASA datasets and tools that can aid with decisions regarding disease outbreaks that are often associated with environmental factors (seasonality, habitat suitability for vector, etc.) that NASA measurements can provide data to assess.

Title: COVID-19 Data Pathfinder
Description: This data pathfinder links to NASA datasets/tools that can aid with decisions regarding the environmental impacts of changes in human behavior from COVID-19.

Title: Water Quality Data Pathfinder - Find Data
Description: Water quality can be remotely sensed and monitored by instruments aboard satellites and aircraft as well as sensors deployed on and under the water's surface.

Title: Health and Air Quality Data Pathfinder - Find Data
Description: Air pollution is one of the largest global environmental and health threats. Instruments aboard NASA satellite and airborne platforms continually acquire data about these pollutants.

Title: Wildfires Data Pathfinder - Find Data
Description: Naturally occurring wildfires can be nearly as impossible to prevent, and as difficult to control, as hurricanes, tornadoes, and floods. Along with their destructive power, they also are a vital component of forest growth, ecological succession, and soil nutrient enhancement. NASA provides datasets and tools for assessing and managing wildfires before, during, and after an event.

Title: EOSDIS Acronym and Symbol List
Description: Acronym and symbol list for NASA's Earth Observing System Data and Information System.

Title: Agriculture and Water Management Data Pathfinder - Find Data
Description: Drought, vegetation health, and soil moisture all can be tracked remotely. This data pathfinder provides links to NASA Earth observations that help address issues like water management for irrigation, crop-type identification and land use, and drought preparedness.
